Upcoming Events


Sep 27, Princeton, NJ

Ixcanul ("Volcano") Film Screening & Discussion

In this award-winning drama, danger arises from a marriage arranged for a Kaqchikel girl living in Guatemala. Following the screening, Dylon Robbins, associate professor and director, Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies at NYU, will give a talk.

Organized by Todor Pophristic and Leone Robbins in conjunction with the Princeton Public Library



Oct 12, Princeton, NJ

Ixcanul ("Volcano") Film Screening & Discussion

In this award-winning drama, danger arises from a marriage arranged for a Kaqchikel girl living in Guatemala. Following the screening, Dylon Robbins, associate professor and director, Center for Latin American and Caribbean Studies at NYU, will give a talk.

Organized by Todor Pophristic and Leone Robbins in conjunction with the Princeton Public Library



Past Events

Aug 06. 2023, Princeton, NJ

Walnut Lane Film Festival

This event showcases five short films in a range of genres created by Princeton Middle School middle school students, organized and curated by students from Princeton High School.

Organized by Todor Pophristic in conjunction with the Princeton Public Library
